title: How to Make S'more Pudding Cookies

steps.headline: Mix the wet ingredients.
steps.description: In a large bowl, beat the butter, vanilla, eggs, sugars, and pudding mix with a stand or hand mixer.

steps.headline: Mix the dry ingredients.
steps.description: Use a medium bowl to combine the flour, graham cracker crumbs, and baking soda with a metal wire whisk.

steps.headline: Incorporate the two bowls.
steps.description: Sift the dry ingredients into the wet ingredient bowl. For the best results and easier stirring, sift a small amount at a time in between stirring.

steps.headline: Add in the marshmallows and chocolate chips.
steps.description: Gently fold the two ingredients into until well incorporated.

steps.headline: Form dough balls.
steps.description: Use a cookie scoop to form 1-inch (2.54 cm) balls and place them on a parchment paper lined baking sheet, about two inches apart from each other.

steps.headline: Bake the cookies for about 8 to 10 minutes.
Allow the cookies to cool.
steps.description: Leave them on the cookie sheet for a few minutes. This is to allow the cookies to actually "set" while still piping hot.

steps.headline: Transfer the cookies to a wire cooling rack.
steps.description: Set aside for about 15 to 20 minutes.

text: Making the Dough Preheat the oven to 350°F (180°C).  Mix the wet ingredients. In a large bowl, beat the butter, vanilla, eggs, sugars, and pudding mix with a stand or hand mixer. Mix the dry ingredients. Use a medium bowl to combine the flour, graham cracker crumbs, and baking soda with a metal wire whisk. Incorporate the two bowls. Sift the dry ingredients into the wet ingredient bowl. For the best results and easier stirring, sift a small amount at a time in between stirring. Add in the marshmallows and chocolate chips. Gently fold the two ingredients into until well incorporated. Baking the Cookies Form dough balls. Use a cookie scoop to form 1-inch (2.54 cm) balls and place them on a parchment paper lined baking sheet, about two inches apart from each other. Bake the cookies for about 8 to 10 minutes.  Allow the cookies to cool. Leave them on the cookie sheet for a few minutes. This is to allow the cookies to actually "set" while still piping hot. Transfer the cookies to a wire cooling rack. Set aside for about 15 to 20 minutes.
